segments.text: The water is just pouring out of the sink like it’s never going to stop.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s already spreading across the floor, and the woman doesn’t even notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is soaked, and she’s just standing there like nothing’s wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm she is while everything around her is falling apart.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are about to make things worse, and she’s not going to see it coming.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is stretching so far, he’s going to tip that stool any second now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for her cookie like it’s the most important thing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I want to laugh at how ridiculous this all is, but I’m too worried about what’s going to happen next.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, and inside is pure chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is one of those moments where everything feels like it’s about to go wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR
